greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of permutations in S_n that avoid the pattern 12453 (or equivalently, 31245).
link: Yonah Biers-Ariel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..37
Yonah Biers-Ariel, Julia program to compute terms
Zvezdelina Stankova-Frenkel and Julian West, A new class of Wilf-equivalent permutations, arXiv:math/0103152 [math.CO], 2001.
formula: Conjecture: a(n) + A158423(n) = n!. - _Benedict W. J. Irwin_, Mar 15 2016
The conjecture is true: All that is needed is to show that 23145 is Wilf-equivalent to 31245, but that’s obvious since they are inverses. - _Doron Zeilberger_ and _Yonah Biers-Ariel_, Feb 26 2019
mathematica: avoid[n_, pat_] := Module[{p1 = pat[[1]], p2 = pat[[2]], p3 = pat[[3]], p4 = pat[[4]], p5 = pat[[5]], lseq = {}, i, p,
xref: Representatives for the 16 Wilf-equivalence patterns of length 5 are given in A116485, A047889, and A256195-A256208. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 19 2015
results.author: Zvezdelina Stankova (stankova(AT)mills.edu), Mar 19 2006
ext: More terms from the Zvezdelina Stankova-Frenkel and Julian West paper. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 19 2015
